intro: Smyrnium matthioli, commonly known as the common cowplant, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its umbellate inflorescence. The plant has finely divided, feathery leaves and small white or greenish flowers that bloom in summer. It is often found in moist meadows and along stream banks, thriving in temperate climates. Smyrnium matthioli is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
